name: influencer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who affects or changes the way that other people behave: Young people are increasingly influencers on their parents' decisions. For a young designer, fashion week is a good opportunity to have an audience with the industry influencers who converge in New York.
a person who is paid by a company to show and describe its products and services on social media, encouraging other people to buy them: In March, she was finally able to quit and focus on her career as an influencer full time.
More examplesFewer examplesPeople who read political blogs are influencers. They organize petition drives and campaign events and spread the word about activities. We want to approach teachers, coaches, and other influencers.For a new generation of journalists, bloggers, and online influencers, services such as Facebook and Twitter help them draw attention to their work.Being an "influencer" is now a fully-fledged career choice and not just a hobby.
